name: smirk
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a smile that expresses satisfaction or pleasure about having done something or knowing something that is not known by someone else: "Maybe your husband does things that you don't know about," he said with a smirk. "I told you it would end in disaster," said Polly with a self-satisfied smirk on her face. Compare
simper noun
More examplesFewer examplesHe left, but not before noticing Christine’s amused smirk.Wipe that stupid smirk off your face!She lifted a hand to her mouth to hide a smirk.

to smile in a way that expresses satisfaction or pleasure about having done something, or knowing something that is not known by someone else: I don't like the way he winks and smirks at me whenever he sees me. He smirked his way through the interview. Compare

More examplesFewer examplesWhat are you smirking at?The defendant appeared to be sniggering and smirking.He will spend his three minutes of glory smirking triumphantly.
